claims.claim: TRAPPIST-1 b shows evidence for heat redistribution beyond the bare-rock reradiation limit, indicating the presence of an atmosphere

evidence.quote: Heat transport efficiency (epsilon) | 0.19 (+0.23 / -0.14) | 0.0 for perfect no-atmosphere limit | Non-zero redistribution is favored
A non-zero redistribution parameter implies transport beyond an immediate bare-rock reradiation limit
The dataset provides meaningful evidence against a strictly airless interpretation for TRAPPIST-1 b

claims.caveat: The heat transport efficiency measurement has substantial uncertainty and the non-zero value, while favored, overlaps with the no-atmosphere boundary within error bounds

claims.claim: Spectral structure near the 15 um CO2 absorption feature is consistent with the presence of a CO2-rich atmosphere

evidence.quote: 15 um CO2 spectral band depth estimate | 96 ppm | Flat-spectrum null | Spectral structure is consistent with atmospheric absorption
Spectral structure near 15 um provides composition-sensitive evidence, especially for CO2-rich scenarios

claims.caveat: The spectral band detection is weak and could be affected by stellar variability or instrument systematics; degeneracies exist between composition and cloud/haze properties

claims.claim: Atmosphere-bearing models provide a statistically better fit to the combined phase-curve and spectral data than no-atmosphere models

evidence.quote: Joint fit likelihood ratio (atmosphere vs no atmosphere) | 7.4 | 1.0 baseline ratio | Atmosphere-bearing models better explain combined data products
Joint constraints from phase curve and spectrum are stronger than either observable alone
A pure no-atmosphere model cannot simultaneously match both phase amplitude and spectral band behavior

claims.caveat: The likelihood ratio of 7.4, while favoring atmosphere models, does not represent a definitive detection; model assumptions and prior choices significantly influence this comparison

claims.claim: TRAPPIST-1 b appears very dark with a Bond albedo upper bound of less than 0.08, suggesting rock-like surface properties

evidence.quote: Bond albedo upper bound | <0.08 | Higher-albedo reflective cases | Planet appears very dark in thermal-energy balance fits

claims.caveat: This albedo constraint depends on the atmospheric and circulation models assumed; without confirmed atmosphere properties, surface albedo interpretation remains uncertain
